author: Ewan Spence
title: Apple Rickrolls The World For Fun And Profit
text:
Well played, Apple, well played.You don't normally expect Cupertino to go for a subtle laugh. Phil Schiller throwing a barbed comment at Android in a keynote presentation, yes, but not an actual slice of hidden humour. Your expectation was wrong. A support page for Apple Watch is going to be the number one entry in 'Top Five Apple Jokes' for many a year to come.How do you add your friends on the Apple Watch? The answer can be found here , but take a closer look at the advice.[caption id="attachment_21105" align="" width="1024"] Apple Watch Support Page (image: Apple.com)[/caption]The initials of the friends already listed run NE VE RG ON NA GI VE YU UP. Apple just rickrolled you:
The meme is a bait and switch; a person provides a hyperlink which is seemingly relevant to the topic at hand, but actually leads to Astley's video. The link can be masked or obfuscated in some manner so that the user cannot determine the true destination of the link without clicking. People led to the music video are said to have been rickrolled . Rickrolling has extended beyond web links to playing the video or song disruptively in other situations, i It's not the first time that the hit single from Rick Astley has featured with Apple - the eponymous music video lurked on one of Craig Federighi's tabs during WWDC 2015 - but there's something a little bit more at play here.[gallery2012]It's very unlikely that this graphic would have appeared on the website without the rick-roll being cleared management. Apple Watch is fighting to establish itself as the leader in the wearables market, and the wearables market is looking to establish itself as a valid area of consumer electronics.The faithful will already have bought their Apple Watches. The job of Apple now is to bring new users to the platform, and that means making it attractive, making it visible, and making it fun. Coupled with the availability of the Apple Watch in stores other than the Apple Store, and the release of WatchOS 2 to extend the capability of the wearable, it lools like the keyword for the Apple Watch is going to be 'playful'. And there's nothing more playful and instantly recognisable as a rickroll.Apple may have rick-rolled the audience, but it creates an intense water-cooler moment around the world, increases the buzz around the Apple Watch, and punctures the stuffiness and earnestness that was built up around the Apple Watch.[caption id="attachment_18272" align="" width="1024"] The Apple Watch (image: Apple.com)[/caption]Steve Jobs always called on John Legend... maybe Tim Cook has found someone to hold Apple together forever?
